node.bodyText: We need to use an English phrase like "Please enter a To Do..."

We need to use a before To Do.
The message should be "Please enter a To Do...".
Here is an explanation: https://chat.openai.com/share/0282ace9-252b-4af5-84f4-c0ed7f802f4f

node.title: Added shareChat
node.body:
check the arguments initialization, I'm not sure it's made correctly, I've tried using your code

> P.S.: `title` in the body of the `PATCH` request in `confirmShareChat` can be edited as the user wants and will result in a custom shared chat name, so it can be an addition. I've left it the original chat's title

I'm leaving a picture of the object coming from `initShare` in case you want to add more details to the list

![Screenshot 2023-07-15 132708](https://github.com/kudoai/chatgpt.js/assets/100418457/6a6d2ec9-9030-49c2-af96-777a4f04f5c7)

nodes.bodyText: hold up something ain't right
yup, as I thought the arguments don't work correctly, anonymous is always true and I dunno why

plus I have this issue


and even tho it gets shared, at least for me, it isn't working. maybe I got rate limited? dunno, you can test it out
ok

It's not doing anything for me, to make sense it should accept index/title/id of chat, if missing select most recent chat, then 2nd param should be 'clipboard' or 'url', if clipboard it should do what exportChat does but to clipboard, if URL it should return the share_url, and if missing also return url
If you rewrite it using that logic then i can fix it up when you're close
ok first, let me break the whole think up for you to understand
well I don't need to understand it yet until it works like that
You can delete the param validation and just make 1st arg chat selector based on that logic, and 2nd arg 'clipboard' or 'url' then i'll add the validation

e.g. the  const validDetails = [ 'is_anonymous', 'is_public', 'is_visible', 'share_id', 'share_url', 'title' ]; is forr validating user input, the user won't be entering any of those because they don't care if it's anonymous/public/visible they just want the share_url

you click the share button

it opens the share popup

and makes a request to https://chat.openai.com/backend-api/share/create
with the following data:
{
    "credentials": "include",
    "method": "POST",
    "headers": {
        "Content-Type": "application/json",
        "Authorization": "Bearer [access token]"
    },
    "body": "{\"current_node_id\":\"2808c276-7120-4d81-a319-07075d614b8d\",\"conversation_id\":\"bba1b35a-215e-4cf0-9b56-9e91610dca36\",\"is_anonymous\":true}"
}
and gets the following response
{
    "share_id": "85160db7-9b3b-4ef0-9346-5b947a1a6141",
    "share_url": "https://chat.openai.com/share/85160db7-9b3b-4ef0-9346-5b947a1a6141",
    "title": "AI Assistance: Hello & Help!",
    "is_public": false,
    "is_visible": true,
    "is_anonymous": true,
    "highlighted_message_id": null,
    "current_node_id": "2808c276-7120-4d81-a319-07075d614b8d",
    "already_exists": true,
    "moderation_state": {
        "has_been_moderated": false,
        "has_been_blocked": false,
        "has_been_accepted": false,
        "has_been_auto_blocked": false,
        "has_been_auto_moderated": false
    }
}
then you click copy link

it makes a request to https://chat.openai.com/backend-api/share/[share_id]
with the following data
{
    "credentials": "include",
    "method": "PATCH",
    "headers": {
        "Content-Type": "application/json",
        "Authorization": "Bearer [access token]"
    },
    "body": "{\"share_id\":\"85160db7-9b3b-4ef0-9346-5b947a1a6141\",\"highlighted_message_id\":null,\"title\":\"AI Assistance: Hello & Help!\",\"is_public\":true,\"is_visible\":true,\"is_anonymous\":true}"
}
the method should successfully do the same exact operations just in the back-end. am I missing something?

When I call chatgpt.shareChat() it doesn't do anything, instead it should take the 1st arg as a chat selector based on title/id/index input by user, if missing, it should use the current chat page's id if it's active, if no chat page is active it should use API to get id of most recent chat. Then the 2nd arg is user input of 'clipboard' or 'url'. if 'clipboard', it should do what chatgpt.exportChat() does but return to clipboard instead of export to .txt. if 'url' or no input is provided, it should make a request to https://chat.openai.com/backend-api/share/create with the node/conversation id's, then return to user the share_url (the copy link requeest is unneeded, nor are any other values from the response)
I'm breaking down the code to see where the issue lies

if you want to emulate openai's two methods though then you should make a makeChatToShare() and copyShareLink() or something, but shareChat() sounds like it should return the chat (or url) to be shared

I'm breaking down the code to see where the issue lies

I think you should rewrite it using my logic and it will be a lot easier (no need to deal with all the other response details if they're in there)

if you want to emulate openai's two methods though then you should make a makeChatToShare() and copyShareLink() or something, but shareChat() sounds like it should return the chat (or url) to be shared

because exportChat() returns to txt, shareChat replaced 'export' with 'share', both being return something externally, but only difference is 'share' implies for others, so URL is logical default value to return (but clipboard also nice, maybe add 'clipboard' as option to exportChat() and in this one you can simply call exportChat('clipboard') if clipboard is requested)
like, look at this. I've added logging for the response text. why am I getting responses but it is not making the chats shareable? it's odd
i'ma check it out

I got
VM4125:1 Uncaught SyntaxError: Unexpected token '<', "<!DOCTYPE "... is not valid JSON
    at JSON.parse (<anonymous>)
    at xhr.onload (chatgpt.js:59:42)

it shouldn't (?) the only parsing is from the endpoints and the objects in the send() of XMLHttpRequest
do you have the endpoints? if so, are they written correctly? because it shouldn't even be happening
I see you're just passing chatToGet without validation so i supplied a long string id instead, same error

it shouldn't (?) the only parsing is from the endpoints and the objects in the send() of XMLHttpRequest
do you have the endpoints? if so, are they written correctly? because it shouldn't even be happening

i didn't add them, now i did and obj's are showing up in log so this is good!
but the share_url strangely leads to a 404
use an index, I haven't made the validations yet since that's the smallest issue since it doesn't share yet

use an index, I haven't made the validations yet since that's the smallest issue since it doesn't share yet

you mean chat id which is what the endpoint takes. but can you make the request with is_anonymous:false instead (that should make 404 go away by setting the is_public to true)
nvm i tried it didn't work
I don't have the share feature so i can't inspect it like you
wait nvm i fonud the share button ill check it out
Your screenshots shows is_public is true while mine are false, you should test the share_url out it could be not 404

nope, still 404. I've uncommented the window.open so it automatically opens the share url and that changes nothing.
YET if I share the chat using the button in the website and then call the method, it opens that same exact url and it works fine
that's odd, so the button is doing something else your makeChatToShare is missing
yes, that's what I'm trying to figure out, because other than that, everything works perfectly fine
I examined the responses of chatgpt UI-created share links vs. this method's and the only difference in response is is_public is true. So that is the ultimate thing to fix

There's a bunch of headers they use like

but I tested most of them already, they didn't affect the is_public or was prevented with security error
then why is it different

maybe one of the sec- headers which can't be included in xhr is required, or cookie required, or cloudflare token required (all things included in the ui version of request) before they make is_public true
you should try posting the question on https://stackoverflow.com
If it's an easy fix then their share_create is definitely ideal, otherwise we have to make a chatExport(html) and call it then upload it to some free file sharing site or something
...but if we can get their version to work, we can even add html to exportChat() without having to build one
There are chatgpt exporter scripts/extensions that probably custom build htmls you can look at the functions as a last resort if we need to do it custom
(OpenAI programmers notoriously copies the features from our scripts like my Full-Window mode, their share_create was definitely inspired by these functions)
Also you could just leave the PR open for anyone who knows how to fix in future (and change title to Building instead of Added)
Also my bad for not explaining before, if you create a branch in your fork dedicated to this feature, you can work on other ones that you can create separate PRs from

There are chatgpt exporter scripts/extensions that probably custom build htmls you can look at the functions as a last resort if we need to do it custom

https://github.com/pionxzh/chatgpt-exporter this is a nice one I've found some time ago

I examined the responses of chatgpt UI-created share links vs. this method's and the only difference in response is is_public is true. So that is the ultimate thing to fix

YES THAT WORKED
there we go, it should be all finished
nice!

navigator.clipboard needs the document to be focused to copy successfully.

may I ask if method is still needed since the chatgpt.alert call already has a button that does the same thing?
let me know when you're done and I'll update the docs right away
what's the endpoint that returns the chat messages?
i saw it before in one of my console inspections i forgot which
i think

endpoints.chat + chatID
https://github.com/kudoai/chatgpt.js/blob/main/chatgpt.js#L553-L578

I think getChatData needs to be moved to chatgpt so there is not all this repetition. Can you move it out without breaking all the methods that use it, so it can be used to also get user responses, then I can use it in exportChat and shareChat too
Because the library is getting too long and the original attraction was it was short and skimmable to see what functions do
Also you can try out creating a branch for this feature (naming it move-getChatData or something)
sure
should I make it for all chats, single chat, or both?

it could be like
1st arg: chatSelector = 'latest' | 'active' | index | title | id of chat to get

if '' or unpassed, defaults to active OpenAI chat if open, otherwise latest chat

2nd arg: detailsToGet = 'id' | 'title' | 'create_time' | 'update_time' | 'msg'

if '' or unpassed, defaults to 'msg'

3rd arg: sender = ( 'all' | 'both' ) | 'user' | 'chatgpt'

if '' or unpassed, defaults to 'all' (if 'msg' passed as 2nd arg)

4th arg: msgToGet = 'all' | 'latest' | index of msg to get

if '' or unpassed, defaults to return all msg's as array (if 'msg' passed as 2nd arg)

what do you think?
So if just chatgpt.getChatData() is typed, it will return all messages of the latest or open chat as an array
Then in chatgpt.exportChat() we can call chatgpt.getChatData() just like that and build a .txt for any chat
...and for chatgpt.exportChat('html') we will still need to call (an improved) chatgpt.shareChat() that can return the HTML from the share_created page
there's no rush, that's why I said make a branch because you can work on other stuff to break up the boredom of working on the same thing
then from there it's smooth sailing because any new methods that rely on chat data will be a breeze to write
Actually chatgpt.getChatDetails()  can be deleted aftter this is made (since it does the same thing but in more versatile way) so that leaves only 1 method to edit to work with new getChatData

Actually even chatgpt.getResponseFromAPI() can be deleted, because chatgpt.getResponse(index) can just call chatgpt.getChatData('', '', 'chatgpt', index) and it will still smartly know if API or DOM based on condition is ChatGPT page open/active, so that leaves no methods needed to be edited to unbreak after this new function's creation
but each one of those functions handles a different key of the xhr response object

...and if you want to keep the chatgpt.getResponseFromAPI(chatToGet, responseToGet, regenResponseToGet) it can simply be replaced with a single line call chatgpt.getChatData(chatToGet, 'msg', 'chatgpt', responseToGet)

but each one of those functions handles a different key of the xhr response object

it's ok it will still work because they will feed different arg's to get the appropriate key
if you can make a single chatgpt.getChatData() work like #92 (comment) then the other ones can be deleted or simplified drastically
it will return different keys from different obj's depending on args
it is like the master method to handle all calls that need chat data, then user-friendly method names can spring up to use this master method for user-specific needs
or hardcore users can just use this master method

but the benefit is the methods with user-friendly names like getResponseFromAPI become much shorter thanks to no repeittion, also allowing many more user-friendly method names to be created with very few lines added
...for example chatgpt.getMyLastMsg() (with just 1 line for def, return await chatgpt.getChatData('', 'msg', 'user', 'latest'))
or chatgpt.resend() (will get last msg and send again with 1 line chatgpt.send(await chatgpt.getChatData('', 'msg', 'user', 'latest')))
The easiest way is to write the logic using lots of repetition for each condition, then after it just works, merging stuff to get rid of the repeated code
A hardcore (but highly satisfying) way is to build the payload & endpoint using ternary logic
In my DDGPT I use ternary to build custom payloads, you could see how beautiful and satisfying it is in getShowReply()
I do understand ternary operators so I can try
Or make 2 obj's if the code's shorter/prettier actually
..but you can use ternary inside the obj's too, including key values in payload depending on param passed, and endpoint URL in XHR
Check out the new language selector on homepage:

it's really cool but I've found 2 issues (at least on mobile)


(optional, minor thing) you can't close the selector by clicking on it, you have to click outside


once you select a language, if you click on the selector again it sets the language back to English and you can't open the selector anymore

I noticed those things too, I was too bored to keep working on it and instead added to a to-do list, then switched to tackling the hundreds of issues in https://sonarcloud.io/project/issues?id=kudoai_chatgpt.js&branch=main&resolved=false&types=CODE_SMELL (that's why i said make branches, if you switch between tasks you will stay focused like me, that's how i get up to 300+ contributions a day)
the tasklist will always keep me busy
geez 😂 I just focus on one thing until it's done, because my brain is so stupid that it fixes bugs and issues when I'm not working on the thing 💀
one thing at a time is good too but wdym fix when not working on it?

I mean like: it's getting late, I'm going to bed. my brain: ah so, yeah, you can fix that problem by doing this
and so I'm left with that idea in mind until the next day
oh i have epiphanies all day i write those down too
yeah and I'm just dumb 😂 anyways, may I ask you if you have any quick contact which is not GitHub issues/PRs? such as Discord for example, that would be ideal
yeah my username is adamlui

node.title: init.py file added and file structed is edited

nodes.bodyText:
I seem to get an error:
*** Error loading script: tagger.py
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "stable-diffusion-webui/modules/scripts.py", line 274, in load_scripts
        script_module = script_loading.load_module(scriptfile.path)
      File "stable-diffusion-webui/modules/script_loading.py", line 10, in load_module
        module_spec.loader.exec_module(module)
      File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap_external>", line 883, in exec_module
      File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 241, in _call_with_frames_removed
      File "stable-diffusion-webui/extensions/stable-diffusion-webui-wd14-tagger/scripts/tagger.py", line 4, in <module>
        from tagger.api import on_app_started
    ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'tagger'

This is due to the lines:
from tagger.api import on_app_started
from tagger.ui import on_ui_tabs

these should now be:
from scripts.tagger.api import on_app_started
from scripts.tagger.ui import on_ui_tabs

there are some more.
fixed after
 rg -l 'from tagger' | xargs -d "\n" -r sed -i 's/from tagger/from scripts.tagger/'

solved some more issues, but it is merged, thanks.
i will work on that. thank for merged. if i can able to do any i will do.
It is fixed, we all make mistakes, I do as well, but please try to run the extension with the changes to catch issues like this.

Sorry, I missed your comments yesterday. There was an issue with the requirements.txt I initially added. I ran to create the requirements.txt
pipreqs --force `pwd`
sed -i s/==.*$//g requirements.txt

but it ended up adding a few external modules that were shadowing webui modules. If you have installed those, due to the initial requirements, you should again remove them. change to the directory of my extension and
pip uninstall webui
pip uninstall modules
pip uninstall launch

In particular installing a module named modules was a serious problem. I don't understand why python did not flag that name as illegal. Sorry for the inconvenience.
I think I'm going to revert this commit, or apply it at a later stage. What is the purpose? This movement of code makes it tough to merge any other code from other branches.
ok i will check these and try. thank you

civitai/sd_civitai_extension#23

Ok I will have a look, thanks. Also I may reapply this later, as I said. It was just very difficult to merge this one, in the end I resolved it manually. I also like to apply this, and then there is no reason anymore to fix the paths again as you proposed.

please read this comment. it can be helpful civitai/sd_civitai_extension#23

launch is no longer in requirements,
I'm not sure.. what are you trying to solve here..?
i want to solve so many errors. but i am unable to load the modules so i just stopped. and took another git project

For me this extension runs without issues. What OS are you running this on, it may be easier to run in a virtual environment. venv or micromamba. Also if you have an issue it is better to create one because the messages below a closed pull request I only sometimes visit, I get no notifications of this.

i am using windows 10. i am trying to work on any project,  the main problem for me  is the error you are getting is not in my computer, before i came to your level error, i have to face lot errors like different things, i am new to github so, dependancies are the big problems. i both are getting same error, i will try my best. but i am not even close to your error point. so much time is wasting. menas not used for solving errors. so if you can able to give any suggessions i am very much accept your suggessions

sounds complex. Do you have ssh access to the server where you install it? In windows there is putty to ssh to a server. Then, if you run it in the console on the remote server the errors may become more clear.

I don't think it is the best option to ask chatgpt for answers. The suggestions may be right sometimes, but sometimes, in particular if 'unsure' it just dreams up very nonsensical things, and then the solutions it hands may do more harm than good. In my opinion the way to solve things is
1 pipoint the exact error
2 query the web using strong keywords that exactly describe this error
then you usually end up on a forum where others had the same issue, and you can resolve it.
Do you have a recent checkout of my extension? I did fix something for fastapi, or at least I think I fixed it. See here

most of them are mainly comes from attributes misplaced. that is the problem main in fast Api. i solved around 3 and are merged. because i am new so i tried. then i want to do on the python. python is big stream so i will try atleast one big quality thing, then it will improve my knowledge.
again thank you for suggestions.
